benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/catalog/xml - Retrieve the full catalog as XML

covered: Valid Request: Core success scenarios for latest catalog and for requestedDate, accountId, and their combination (TC01-TC04) are present.
Content-Type and payload format: Tests assert text/xml and valid/well-formed XML responses (TC01-TC04, TC19).
Empty / No-data handling: Scenarios for no catalog and empty catalog structures exist (TC05, TC15).
Query parameter validation: Valid/invalid requestedDate and accountId formats and non-matching dates are covered (TC02, TC06, TC07, TC08, TC16).
Authorization/Authentication: Unauthorized and forbidden scenarios are present (TC10, TC11).
Error handling for downstream/service failures and timeouts: Service unavailable and timeout scenarios are present (TC12, TC22).
Security input validation: Malicious/injection attempts are tested (TC13).
Robustness & non-functional: Large-data, performance, peak-load, concurrency, transient recovery and regression tests are included (TC17, TC18, TC14, TC21, TC22, TC19).
Backward compatibility and accessibility: Schema/compatibility and accessibility scenarios are present where UI display applies (TC20, TC23, TC24).
gaps: Pagination: No test covers pagination behavior or page-size parameters for large results (guideline expects pagination checks).
Caching Behavior: No scenarios validate caching headers or behavior (ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control, conditional GETs).
Rate Limiting / Throttling: There are no explicit tests for rate limits or 429 responses when requests exceed quotas.

Exact error-code mapping and message content: Several error scenarios allow a range (e.g., "404 or 400") instead of asserting the precise expected status and error body; lack of assertions for standardized error payload structure and message content.
Missing "resource not found" for accountId: No explicit scenario for a valid UUID accountId that exists-format but has no associated tenant catalog (i.e., account not found/empty vs invalid format).
Accept header / content negotiation: No tests that validate handling of Accept header or behavior when client requests other formats.
Caching under concurrent access: While concurrency/performance is covered, there are no tests checking cache coherency or stale-while-revalidate behavior under concurrent requests.
Pagination-related performance: Performance tests do not exercise paginated endpoints (if pagination is supported) to check streaming/chunking or incremental transfer behavior.
recommendations: Add pagination tests (if applicable) covering page size, page number, large offsets, and behavior when page params are out of range; include performance tests that exercise paginated responses and streaming.
Add caching tests: verify ETag/Last-Modified/Cache-Control headers, conditional GET behavior (If-None-Match / If-Modified-Since) and validate 304 responses.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate bursts of requests to verify 429 handling, Retry-After header, and graceful degradation under quota limits.

Tighten error assertions: define expected HTTP status codes and a canonical error payload schema for each failure case (e.g., 400 vs 404) and add assertions for error codes/messages to avoid ambiguous outcomes.
Add negative scenario for accountId that is a valid UUID but does not map to any account/catalog (verify 404 or documented behavior).
Add Accept-header / content-negotiation tests: request application/json or */* and ensure behavior is correct or returns 406 if unsupported.
Add tests for caching behavior under concurrency to ensure no stale or corrupted responses when many clients request the same resource simultaneously.
Automate XML schema validation: add tests that validate response XML against the authoritative schema to cover structure, namespaces, and required elements rather than just "well-formed".
Include explicit header checks beyond Content-Type (Content-Length, Content-Encoding) and validate streaming/chunked responses for very large catalogs.
